Player History
Drafted in 52nd round, 819th overall pick, by San Francisco in 2015...
Injured on 6/25/2015 with a Stiff Knee, out for one week...
Signed as a free agent by Seattle on 3/1/2016 to a minor league contract.
Injured on 8/22/2016 with a Bruised Hand, out for 2 days...
Had first career hit on 8/5/2017, off Henry Lee (CHI)...
Hit first career homerun on 8/11/2017, off Fernando Cantu (BRO)...
1/31/2018: Gets a new one-year contract worth $550,000 through salary arbitration...
1/31/2019: Gets a new one-year contract worth $550,000 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Seattle to Cincinnati on 7/25/2019 (Going to SEA: RF Oscar Cuellar, SS Raymond Carper. Going to CIN: SS Geraldo Egea)...
Won World Series with Cincinnati in 2019...
1/31/2020: Gets a new one-year contract worth $552,857 through salary arbitration...
Won World Series with Cincinnati in 2020...
Signed as a free agent by Brooklyn on 2/3/2021 to a 4-year deal worth $2,000,000 per year...
